Detailed Description

Base class for construct editor for XINX.

Since:
0.7.2.0

This base class contains minimum method necessary to construct an editor. An editor has a name, a title, and method related with clipboard.

Editor Content View

The editor has a model for show content of it. The best way is to use the ContentView2 name space and ContentView2::TreeModel to show the content of the file, and for completion in the editor.

This model will be show in the Content View Dock of XINX

Editor Serialization

An editor can be serialized and deserialized in a XinxProjectSessionEditor (this object save datas in XML Document). For this child editor must registered by using :

   qRegisterMetaType<MyEditor>("MyEditor");

The editor must use the Q_OBJECT macro too. The system use QObject::metaObject() classes to get some editor information. You must save and restore your member in the methode serialize() and deserialize().

Editor's files

This class is also an editor that can read and write from and to a file. This class open the file (with the correct option) and call loadFromDevice() and saveToDevice(). This method must be redifined to really read or save the file.

If your goal is to make a text editor, you should use the object TextFileEditor instead of AbstractEditor.

If a file is modified with an external application and in condition of XINXConfig::self()->config().editor.popupWhenFileModified to true, a popup dialog ask to refresh the file in the editor. If the file wasn't modify in the editor, the file is reloaded without prompt.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbstractEditor::SearchOption

Options used for search text in the editor.

Enumerator:
ONLY_SELECTION 

Search only the selected element (text, widget, ...).

BACKWARD 

Inverse the searching mode and search before the cursor.

WHOLE_WORDS 

Search a whole word and not a piece of word.

REGULAR_EXPRESSION 

The search string is a regular expression.

SEARCH_FROM_START 

Search from the start of the document (backward and selection must be ignored).

MATCH_CASE 

The search is case sensitive.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AbstractEditor::AbstractEditor ( QWidget *  parent = 0  ) 

Create an objects of type AbstractEditor.

An editor is based on the QFrame object. Your widgets must be added in the QFrame object, with help of a QLayout. You can use BorderLayout of the components library or Qt layout.

The layout of the frame will be created later by EditorFactory. For this you must re-implemente initLayout()

Parameters:
parent Parent and containers of the editor.
AbstractEditor::~AbstractEditor (  )  [virtual]

Destroy the created frame editor.

AbstractEditor::AbstractEditor ( const AbstractEditor &  editor  )  [protected]

Constructor used to copy the editor content.

This constructor must only exist for serialization works. You don't have to create your own copy constructor. The editor use the same parent of editor but don't copy members of AbstractEditor. It's used to create a new AbstractEditor.

Parameters:
editor The original editor used for copy.

Implemented in TextFileEditor.

bool AbstractEditor::canCopy (  )  [pure virtual]

Check if the editor has the capacity to copy or cut data to the clipboard.

In practice, this method must return true if the user have selected text, element, ... The signal copyAvailable() is emmited when this value change.

Returns:
true if the editor can copy or cut data to clipboard else return false.
See also:
copy(), cut(), copyAvailable()

Implemented in TextFileEditor.

AbstractEditor * AbstractEditor::deserializeEditor ( XinxProjectSessionEditor *  data  )  [static]

Create the editor and deseroalize it.

This static method is used by EditorFactory to restore the editor. This method create the right class with the help of the ClassName property, QMetaType::type(name) and QMetaType::construct(id).

Next this method call the virtual method deserialize()

Parameters:
data from what the data must be read
Returns:
An editor
See also:
serialize(), deserialize()
bool AbstractEditor::find ( const QString &  text,
AbstractEditor::SearchOptions  options 
) [pure virtual, slot]

Search the text in the document, and select it.

The parameter options is the same of the parameter throw via initSearch().

Parameters:
text The text to search in the document
options User options used to find the text
QString AbstractEditor::getLongTitle (  )  const [virtual]

Get the long title of the editor.

It can be use on the TabWidget to inform user in a tool type. If the method getFileName() return an empty string, the editor retorun the content of defaultFileName(), else the filename with path is returned.

Returns:
The title of frame.
See also:
hasName()
QString AbstractEditor::getTitle (  )  const [virtual]

Get the title of the editor.

Return the title of the FileEditor. The title return the value of defaultFileName(), if the method getFileName() return an empty string else return the File name (without the path).

Returns:
The title to use with Tab name
See also:
getFileName(), hasName()
QIcon AbstractEditor::icon (  )  const [virtual]

Return an icon that represent the editor.

Returns:
an icon for the editor.
void AbstractEditor::initLayout (  )  [protected, virtual]

This method is used to initialize the layout.

It can be used to add an header, a footer or to create an editor with a grid layout. All your imagination can be here. The TextFileEditor will have it's own layout, who can be replaced later by a child class.

By default this method do nothing (no layout created).

Reimplemented in TextFileEditor.

void AbstractEditor::initSearch ( AbstractEditor::SearchOptions &  options  )  [pure virtual, slot]

This method will be called before the search/replace begins to define the option to use and initialize some variables.

Options to use are defined in AbstractEditor::SearchOption. This method can prepare the search by init the cursor, ...

Parameters:
options Options used to search text.
virtual bool AbstractEditor::isModified (  )  [virtual]
const QString & AbstractEditor::lastFileName (  )  const

Return the last name used with loadFromFile() or saveToFile().

void AbstractEditor::loadFromDevice ( QIODevice &  d  )  [pure virtual]

Load the editor from a device (from a file, the memory or any medium).

The QIODevice must be open for reading and seek to the position 0.

Note:
If you want use a Text editor, you should use TextFileEditor who already re-implement this method.
Parameters:
d The device where XINX must load.

Implemented in TextFileEditor.

void AbstractEditor::loadFromFile ( const QString &  fileName = QString()  )  [virtual]

Load the editor from the file fileName.

This method open the file fileName and pass an opened QFile to loadFromDevice().

This method call method IXinxInputOutputPlugin::loadFile() of all plugin who implements this method.

Parameters:
fileName The file name to load
See also:
saveToFile()

Reimplemented in TextFileEditor.

Return the model that represent the content of the editor.

This model will be show in the in the Content View Dock of XINX as describe Editor Content View upper.

Implemented in TextFileEditor.

void AbstractEditor::open ( const QString &  filename,
int  line 
) [signal]

Signal emited when the editor request to open a file is made.

This signal can be emited when the user Ctrl+CLICK to ask to open the file filename at the position line where you can find the definition of the word choose by the user.

Parameters:
filename file name of the file to open
line line of the file to open

void AbstractEditor::replace ( const QString &  from,
const QString &  to,
AbstractEditor::SearchOptions  options 
) [pure virtual, slot]

Replace the current selection by the user text.

This method is called after the method find(), if the searching is in mode replace. The parameter options is the same of the parameter throw via initSearch().

Parameters:
from The text to replace (as asked by user so be aware of regexp)
to The text the user want to put. (if regexp \1, \2 is catched text)
options User options used to replace the text
void AbstractEditor::saveToDevice ( QIODevice &  d  )  [pure virtual]

Save the editor in a device(to a file, in the memory, or any medium).

The QIODevice must be open for reading and seek to the position 0.

Note:
If you want use a Text editor, you should use TextFileEditor who already re-implement this method.
Parameters:
d The device where XINX must write.

Implemented in TextFileEditor.

void AbstractEditor::saveToFile ( const QString &  fileName = QString()  )  [virtual]

Save the editor's content to file fileName.

This method open the file fileName and pass an opened QFile to saveToDevice(). Before saving, if XINXConfig::self()->config().editor.createBackupFile is true, a backup file is created in appending ".bak" to the original filename.

This method call method IXinxInputOutputPlugin::saveFile() of all plugin who implements this method.

Parameters:
fileName The file name to save.
See also:
loadFromFile()

Reimplemented in TextFileEditor.

void AbstractEditor::serialize ( XinxProjectSessionEditor *  data,
bool  content 
) [virtual]

Serialize the editor and return the value in a XinxProjectSessionEditor.

The serialization save internal data of the editor (modified, content, position of cursor, file name, ...). The format of the data depend of XinxProjectSessionEditor.

Parameters:
data where datas must be stored.
content If true, the editor save the modifed content, else the editor must save only the state.
See also:
deserialze(), deserialzeEditor()

Reimplemented in TextFileEditor.
